abstract: Interviews and public opinion surveys show that Pres Obama's standing remains remarkably strong among African-Americans; the challenge for Obama's campaign lies in whether it can energize those voters and draw them to the polls.
snippet: President Obama’s standing remains remarkably strong among African-Americans, but Democrats say turning out those voters in 2012 remains a challenge.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s standing remains remarkably strong among African-Americans, but Democrats say turning out those voters in 2012 remains a challenge.

headline.main: Black Voters’ Support for Obama Is Steady and Strong
headline.print_headline: Black Support for Obama Is Steady and Strong
